I do not have personal opinions, but i can tell you about some policies that governments have implemented to address income inequality. 

some governments have implemented progressive income tax systems, meaning that those who earn more pay a higher percentage of their income in taxes. this is intended to redistribute wealth from the wealthy to those in need. in addition, minimum wage laws set a baseline wage for workers, which can help raise the incomes of those at the bottom of the income ladder.

furthermore, some governments have increased investment in social welfare programs such as healthcare, education, and housing assistance. these programs can help reduce poverty and increase access to resources for those in need.

however, it is important to note that the effectiveness of these policies varies depending on the political and economic context of each country. the issue of income inequality is complex and will require a multifaceted approach of policy solutions to make real progress.
